10.21.19  4:49 am   How does the story in La de da de da de da de day oh end?

     it's not a story it's a song, but the conundrum i was faced with was, bringing the chorus to its normal resolution seemed to feel a bit bland. so after trying various different permutations of the instrumental riff (found after the 1st chorus), nothing seemed to be working so i went with an old standard stunt i like to do which is to ditch into cobweb mode and get out

10.21.19  2:17 am   do you ever plan on making a full-length album?

     with no length limits on albums any more, length limit is literally infinity. so every song i've released is part of a full length album, which is not done because i am still making it longer but i am releasing the songs as i go, for your listening convenience

10.21.19  1:07 am   you like bread?

     as long as it's not short bread. i only like the very tall bread

10.21.19  12:21 am   how did you make those cool backgrounds with a million copies of an icon or piece of text scrolling past each other?

     tile the thing, save as hi res image, by the way if you don't have any tiling software, you can just copy then copy them both and then copy all 4 then copy all 8 and 16, 32, 64, 128 etc. then get 2 images and set them to different composite/blend modes or transparency, then scroll them past each other with a linear keyframe. then for some extra fun, export that video then re-import it and double it and gently do a hair or 2 more things on it. then if you still have time to spare, do it again

10.20.19  11:09 pm   will you know when to stop reinventing yourself?

     i hope so

      gotta save some invention for next reinvention, right?  asking for a friend

10.20.19  10:27 pm   Do you know the square root of 7? my calculator is broken and I need help. 

     maybe like 2.7 or less

10.20.19  10:07 pm   it's been forever since i had a truly exciting technological exploration like you're having now so i'm living vicariously through you for a bit if that's ok. coming to this page and hearing about what you've figured out or what new challenge you're tackling excites me (not despite, but regardless of, the fact that yOu AreN'T rEleAsInG nEw CoNtEnt bCuz hIAtUs or whatever the vocal minority thinks). sorry if reminding you of the external pressure from fans stressed you out. i bring it up only to emphasize that at least in my mind, fuck that noise, i'm real fuckin excited for you dude! you're getting things done and that's how you do it!!!!! anyway i guess my question is what's on the to do list for today?

     i'm currently working on a kbm/regex solution for searching the master xml plist file of all kbm macro information to update the keyboards display diagram, specifically i'm currently working on showing it how to use the date-modified of the macros to know how to only update the ones that have changed since the last update. rather than wiping and rebuilding the whole thing, which currently clocks in at about 28 seconds at best

     can you slack the homework somehow

10.20.19  5:55 pm   Hi Bill! I have a work in progress song I'm  composing digitally, but there are so many areas I feel uncomfortable with. Any tips for helping me get over my fear of getting into unfamiliar areas of songwriting/making? Thanks!

     if you're feeling overwhelmed, a good catch-all solution for this is to simply start making the songs much shorter. like much shorter. 22 seconds. 12 seconds. ...... still, a lot of unknown fears can lurk even in 12 seconds, so don't be afraid to dial it back to, yep i said it, .... 4 seconds. if you can't do that, then try 3. if you think this is insane, i dare you to not have fun while writing a 2 second song. and this way you'll get to take a tour of the entire songwriting factory, instantly. your level of experience will soon double and triple, effortlessly, as easy as eating grains of rice

10.20.19  5:40 pm   Are there any clues as to what your next project is?

     extremely

10.20.19  12:30 am   I feel like all my songs follow the same structure. What do i do to change that?

     find a song with another structure and try to write a different song that somehow matches that structure. don't forget the golden rule, which is there's infinite structures
